description: Update hex-encoded bitcoin transaction or create hex-encoded bitcoin transaction

subcommands.name: bitcoin-tx locktime
subcommands.description: Set TX lock time to N

subcommands.name: bitcoin-tx outmultisig
subcommands.description: Add Pay To n-of-m Multi-sig output to TX

subcommands.name: bitcoin-tx outscript
subcommands.description: Add raw script output to TX

subcommands.name: bitcoin-tx replaceable
subcommands.description: Set RBF opt-in sequence number for input N

subcommands.name: bitcoin-tx sign
subcommands.description: Add zero or more signatures to transaction

subcommands.name: bitcoin-tx load
subcommands.description: Load JSON file FILENAME into register NAME

subcommands.name: bitcoin-tx set
subcommands.description: Set register NAME to given JSON-STRING

options.description: Print this help message and exit
Output only the hex-encoded transaction id of the resultant transaction
Use the signet chain. Equivalent to -chain=signet.
Blocks must satisfy the given script to be considered valid (only for signet networks)
Specify a seed node for the signet network, in the hostname[:port] format
Use the test chain. Equivalent to -chain=test.

name: bitcoin-tx
raw_help_text:
Bitcoin Core bitcoin-tx utility version v24.0.1

Usage:  bitcoin-tx [options] <hex-tx> [commands]  Update hex-encoded bitcoin transaction
or:     bitcoin-tx [options] -create [commands]   Create hex-encoded bitcoin transaction

Options:

  -?
       Print this help message and exit

  -create
       Create new, empty TX.

  -json
       Select JSON output

  -txid
       Output only the hex-encoded transaction id of the resultant transaction.

  -version
       Print version and exit

Debugging/Testing options:

Chain selection options:

  -chain=<chain>
       Use the chain <chain> (default: main). Allowed values: main, test,
       signet, regtest

  -signet
       Use the signet chain. Equivalent to -chain=signet. Note that the network
       is defined by the -signetchallenge parameter

  -signetchallenge
       Blocks must satisfy the given script to be considered valid (only for
       signet networks; defaults to the global default signet test
       network challenge)

  -signetseednode
       Specify a seed node for the signet network, in the hostname[:port]
       format, e.g. sig.net:1234 (may be used multiple times to specify
       multiple seed nodes; defaults to the global default signet test
       network seed node(s))

  -testnet
       Use the test chain. Equivalent to -chain=test.

Commands:

  delin=N
       Delete input N from TX

  delout=N
       Delete output N from TX

  in=TXID:VOUT(:SEQUENCE_NUMBER)
       Add input to TX

  locktime=N
       Set TX lock time to N

  nversion=N
       Set TX version to N

  outaddr=VALUE:ADDRESS
       Add address-based output to TX

  outdata=[VALUE:]DATA
       Add data-based output to TX

  outmultisig=VALUE:REQUIRED:PUBKEYS:PUBKEY1:PUBKEY2:....[:FLAGS]
       Add Pay To n-of-m Multi-sig output to TX. n = REQUIRED, m = PUBKEYS.
       Optionally add the "W" flag to produce a
       pay-to-witness-script-hash output. Optionally add the "S" flag to
       wrap the output in a pay-to-script-hash.

  outpubkey=VALUE:PUBKEY[:FLAGS]
       Add pay-to-pubkey output to TX. Optionally add the "W" flag to produce a
       pay-to-witness-pubkey-hash output. Optionally add the "S" flag to
       wrap the output in a pay-to-script-hash.

  outscript=VALUE:SCRIPT[:FLAGS]
       Add raw script output to TX. Optionally add the "W" flag to produce a
       pay-to-witness-script-hash output. Optionally add the "S" flag to
       wrap the output in a pay-to-script-hash.

  replaceable(=N)
       Set RBF opt-in sequence number for input N (if not provided, opt-in all
       available inputs)

  sign=SIGHASH-FLAGS
       Add zero or more signatures to transaction. This command requires JSON
       registers:prevtxs=JSON object, privatekeys=JSON object. See
       signrawtransactionwithkey docs for format of sighash flags, JSON
       objects.

Register Commands:

  load=NAME:FILENAME
       Load JSON file FILENAME into register NAME

  set=NAME:JSON-STRING
       Set register NAME to given JSON-STRING
